result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court for Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter.  Attorney Francesco Mineo appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Plea hearing.

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 2 and 4 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Counts 1 and 3: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint/ Information as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case adjourned to Branch 16 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed. REQUESTED BAIL MODIFICATION

OFF THE RECORD- Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared on behalf of Francesco Mineo for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defense counsel requests a Plea Hearing date. Court grants request and adjourns matter to Br 16.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter not in court, in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Sargent appeared by video means. Defense is requesting more time to review discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING (16 pages) commencing 06-22-2022 by JENNIFER L. CARTER.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Stark.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Grayson, Br. 16.

Defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter in court with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent; both appear by video.  Defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer J. Hermann. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Davontae Jarell Smith-Carter in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
